name: chai-validate-response
description: A chai assertion plugin for validating Responses with a Swagger / OAI schema

scripts.prepublish: npm run lint && npm run build && npm run build

author: Tom Forrer <tom.forrer@gmail.com> (github.com/tmf)

validate-commit-msg.helpMessage:
-----------

There was a small validation problem with your commit message:

> %s

It's not a huge problem, but a valid commit message will ensure
whether your commit triggers a release or not (and sometimes the
commit won't need to trigger a commit). If you really need to, you
can skip the validation using `git commit --no-verify`.

If your commit is a fix, it might want to be:

> fix: storage bug

Or a feature:

> feat: added new storage process

There's also `docs`, `test` and `chore` and a few more. To read
how the commit message should be formatted, please see this short
post: https://git.io/v2Nnm
